results.title: The Great War
results.creator_credit: Alan Anderson, Frank Bagnall and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “War Experience”.
Uses contemporary film records of the Australian forces in the 1914-18 War to illustrate the conditions in which they served and the effects on survivors.

results.title: The Sentence of the court
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “BBC Scene”.
This docudrama looks at what the subsequent history might have been of the boys in the gang that attacked the conductor in the film the “Last Bus” (Title code 006006). Examines the factors which might have caused the boys behaviour, their likely punishment and its effect on them. Companion film to “Last Bus”.

results.title: The Great Gatsby
results.creator_credit: Jack Clayton, David Merrick, Paramount Pictures and Newdorn Company
results.brief_description: F. Scott Fitzgerald’s masterpiece is a story that could only have taken place in the Jazz Age: an era in which recklessness with money, liquor, women and fast cars pervaded the American consciousness. Robert Redford is Jay Gatsby, the dashing, enigmatic millionaire obsessed with the elusive and spoiled Daisy Buchanan (Mia Farrow). The screenplay for this elegant story was conceived with a meticulous concern for language, time and place by Francis Ford Coppola. Cast also includes Karen Black, Scott Wilson, Sam Waterson, Lois Chiles, Bruce Dern, Howard da Silva, Patsy Kensit.

results.title: My happiest years
results.creator_credit: David Gill, Kevin Brownlow and Thames Television
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Unknown Chaplin”.
The first of a trilogy throwing new light on Chaplin’s career in films. This part covers the period in which he made twelve 2 reel comedies. Using footage selected from previously uncut rushes, the progression of Chaplin’s ideas is uncovered and insight is given into his working methods. Narrated by James Mason. Rated: G

results.title: Hidden treasures
results.creator_credit: David Gill, Kevin Brownlow and Thames Production
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Unknown Chaplin”.
Featuring Charlie Chaplin in previously unseen home movies, scenes from abandoned films and scenes cut from release prints of the classics “City Lights” and “Modern Times”. Narrated by James Mason.

results.title: Last bus
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “BBC Scene”.
A docudrama featuring a group of teenage boys who attack a bus conductor on a late night journey. None of the passengers go to the conductor’s aid. Afterwards the passengers try to justify their inactivity to an interviewer who tries to discover why the boys did it. See companion film “The Sentence of the court” (Title code 009645).

results.title: The Great director
results.creator_credit: David Gill, Kevin Brownlow and Thames Television
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Unknown Chaplin”.
The second of a trilogy throwing new light on Chaplin’s career in films. In 1917 he became independent and built his own studio. Stills, camera tests and rushes are organised to produce new insights into his famous classics, “The Kid”, “The Gold Rush” and “City Lights”. Narrated by James Mason. Rated: G
